raw.title: [BIP-367] Update addresses for emergency multisigs
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/380

@juani has recently been promoted to head of Smart Contracts at Balancer Labs while @nventuro has shifted to a technical advisory role. Nico's still going to be actively helping the smart contracts team at Balancer Labs though at a lower time commitment than full time. 

With this change, I'd like to suggest replacing Nico's address:
* 0x815d654E930E840D0E0Ee1B18FFc8Fb4ddA4c6B3 

by Juani's address: 
* 0xB5485e0F543eE6e01e221A57e58ED95268215Ac9

on the emergency multisigs across all networks (see details on the multisigs [here](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/form-the-emergency-subdao/3197)). 

Both @juani and @nventuro agreed with this suggestion and can confirm that by commenting in this thread below.

(edit:) Also, @markus requests (see his comment in this thread) to change his address from: 
* 0x6bB4720473d4D7133f944785e5EE1A650C07f34e

To: 
* 0xCae6f77a6cf4C952BF36793D91519fb4Ae86C264

### Specification:

Due to two different safe configurations between all the networks, two separate structures will be passed to each gnosis safe. 

Mainnet `0xA29F61256e948F3FB707b4b3B138C5cCb9EF9888 `
Gnosis `0xd6110A7756080a4e3BCF4e7EBBCA8E8aDFBC9962 `
zkEVM `0x79b131498355daa2cC740936fcb9A7dF76A86223` 

#### Will call `swapOwner` twice, on the respective safe passing:
(1)
prevOwner: `0xbbF0Ae5195444264364CA7eb7E3BB1971B4c3eCb`
oldOwner: `0x815d654E930E840D0E0Ee1B18FFc8Fb4ddA4c6B3`
newOwner: `0xB5485e0F543eE6e01e221A57e58ED95268215Ac9`
(2)
prevOwner: `0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17`
oldOwner: `0x6bB4720473d4D7133f944785e5EE1A650C07f34e`
newOwner: `0xCae6f77a6cf4C952BF36793D91519fb4Ae86C264`
[/details]
Optimism `0xd4c87b33afcE39F1E3F4aF1ce8fFFF7241d9128B`
Arbitrum `0xf404C5a0c02397f0908A3524fc5eb84e68Bbe60D`
Polygon `0x3c58668054c299bE836a0bBB028Bee3aD4724846`

#### Will call `swapOwner` twice, on the respective safe passing:
(1)
prevOwner: `0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17`
oldOwner: `0x815d654E930E840D0E0Ee1B18FFc8Fb4ddA4c6B3`
newOwner: `0xB5485e0F543eE6e01e221A57e58ED95268215Ac9`
(2)
prevOwner: `0x512fce9B07Ce64590849115EE6B32fd40eC0f5F3`
oldOwner: `0x6bB4720473d4D7133f944785e5EE1A650C07f34e`
newOwner: `0xCae6f77a6cf4C952BF36793D91519fb4Ae86C264`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: Form the Emergency subDAO
raw.author: 0x512fce9B07Ce64590849115EE6B32fd40eC0f5F3
raw.body:
This proposal appears on [Balancer's forum](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/form-the-emergency-subdao/3197)

# Motivation

The [Emergency DAO](https://dao.curve.fi/emergencymembers) is an idea pioneered by Curve that empowers a small group to “kill” pools and gauges in the event of malicious activity and/or potential loss of funds. So far the power has only been used once to [kill the Mochi pool](https://gov.curve.fi/t/the-curve-emergency-dao-has-killed-the-usdm-gauge/2307).

This proposal is being presented as a response to the situation Balancer is facing regarding the three element pools ([1](https://app.element.fi/pools/0xEdf085f65b4F6c155e13155502Ef925c9a756003?action=redeem))([2](https://app.element.fi/pools/0x4bd6D86dEBdB9F5413e631Ad386c4427DC9D01B2?action=redeem))([3](https://app.element.fi/pools/0x7Edde0CB05ED19e03A9a47CD5E53fC57FDe1c80c?action=redeem)) which were grandfathered into the gauge voting system when veBAL launched. A single LP has staked in the gauges and has bribed on hidden hand to entice voters while this single actor collects all the emissions.

Given that these element pools have expired they should no longer be eligible for BAL emissions.

The Emergency subDAO will be a 4-of-7 multisig with the following members:

* Solarcurve (0x512fce9B07Ce64590849115EE6B32fd40eC0f5F3)
* Mike B (0xF01Cc7154e255D20489E091a5aEA10Bc136696a8)
* Zekraken (0xafFC70b81D54F229A5F50ec07e2c76D2AAAD07Ae)
* Zen Dragon (0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17)
* Markus (0x6bB4720473d4D7133f944785e5EE1A650C07f34e)
* Fernando (0xbbF0Ae5195444264364CA7eb7E3BB1971B4c3eCb)
* Nico (0x815d654E930E840D0E0Ee1B18FFc8Fb4ddA4c6B3)

Gnosis safe address: `0xA29F61256e948F3FB707b4b3B138C5cCb9EF9888`

A governance proposal will be required to change signers of this multisig. To be clear, Balancer’s Emergency subDAO will only have the power to kill gauges. Balancer pools cannot be “killed” by governance after the pool factory has been deployed for three months.

An additional power of the Emergency subDAO will be to add a token to the deny list on the newly created “[ProtocolFeesWithdrawer](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/introduce-protocolfeeswithdrawer/3188)” contract. In order for a token to be added back to the allow list a veBAL governance vote would be required. A token would only be added to the deny list in the event of an issue along the lines of the recent [Synthetix bug disclosure](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/medium-severity-bug-found/3161). 

# Specification

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will call `grantRoles` on the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` with the following arguments:

roles: `[0xec1d467d9ab03a0079c22a89037209f5763aec973897ea763e2cf25d71a5f12e, 0xa5a62b55fdf9496f8e1b3feba479423a4349b385bd444f893b3cd4cf9387ce3f]`

account: `0xA29F61256e948F3FB707b4b3B138C5cCb9EF9888`

The role `0xec1d467d9ab03a0079c22a89037209f5763aec973897ea763e2cf25d71a5f12e` corresponds to killing gauges and `0xa5a62b55fdf9496f8e1b3feba479423a4349b385bd444f893b3cd4cf9387ce3f` corresponds to adding a token to the deny list in `ProtocolFeesWithdrawer`

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: This proposal seeks to update the multisig signers for the Emergency subDAO Multisig to align with current strategic needs and team composition, ensuring security and efficient management.
key_arguments_for: Current signers are being removed due to changes in involvement and operational responsibilities.
New signers include strategic partners and active community members enhancing geographic and operational coverage.
Early and stable voting timeline strongly supports the 'Yes' option.
Similar past proposals with 'Yes' outcomes have been successfully implemented despite minor post-vote TVL declines.
key_arguments_against: One negative sentiment comment in the forum reflects some concerns or reservations.
Small vote share against and an abstain vote indicate some minor dissent.

evidence.quote: Proposal aims to update multisig signers due to team changes and strategic alignment.
Timeline metrics show consistent and stable voting with full early support for the 'Yes' choice.
Adjacent proposals with similar 'Yes' outcomes show minor negative TVL impacts but successful implementation.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- The voting timeline exhibits strong, stable early support exclusively for the 'Yes' option, indicating clear community intent.
- Forum sentiment is predominantly neutral with one negative comment; overall, the sentiment aligns with the recommendation.
- Similar past proposals also favored 'Yes' and although they experienced minor post-vote TVL declines, they resulted in successful protocol improvements; these lessons affirm that small negative impacts do not outweigh long-term benefits.
- Market impact shows a positive token price change, supporting the beneficial outlook of the proposal.
Hence, the recommendation to 'Change' aligns with both the voting data and community sentiment, maximizing the DAO’s long-term security and operational efficiency.
